snippet: The U.S. representative to the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons said a simple condemnation of Syria wasn’t enough as the country is about to miss a deadline for the destruction of its chemical munitions.
abstract: United States suggests that Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons will have to take more assertive action than simple condemnation concerning Syria, which will miss June 30 deadline for destruction of its chemical munitions and has been accused of using chlorine-gas bombs in its civil war.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. representative to the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons said a simple condemnation of Syria wasn’t enough as the country is about to miss a deadline for the destruction of its chemical munitions.

headline.main: U.S. Suggests Getting Tougher With Syria on Chemical Weapons Deadline
headline.print_headline: U.S. Suggests Getting Tougher With Syria on Chemical Weapons Deadline

keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
keywords.name: organizations
